label: 四大種
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: In Buddhist thought, all material objects, including man, are composed of four basic elements, earth, water, fire, and wind, known as the four great seeds (shidaishu).  (p. 764)↓[Sk. catvāri mahābhūtāni]
